events.title: SEC Charges in Insider Trading Case
events.description: The SEC filed a settled civil fraud action against Epstein and others for illegal insider trading.

keyFacts: Jeffrey S. Epstein was involved in a settled insider trading case alongside Allen M. Glick and others.
The SEC charged Epstein and his associates with illegal insider trading in three publicly-traded Massachusetts banks.
The defendants, including Epstein, consented to final judgments permanently enjoining them from violating federal securities laws.
The total amount agreed upon for disgorgement and penalties exceeded $437,000.
The document includes personal details about Epstein, including his date of birth and nationality.
